intro: Linaria rodriguezii, commonly known as Rodriguez's toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its slender stems and narrow leaves are adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat. Linaria rodriguezii is often found in coastal areas and is considered a rare and endemic species.
